publications.description: The lack of proper orientation prior to the commencement of the Student Industrial Work Experience Scheme (SIWES) has been identified as one of the challenges facing the scheme. In addressing this identified challenge, a four-stage Industry Immersion Programme for Students (IIP4S) consisting of: Planning, Orientation and Training, Industry Immersion and Impact has been proposed in this paper as the solution to this problem. In evaluating the effectiveness of each stage of the scheme, the quantitative data collection method was used. The data obtained were then analyzed to evaluate the effect of organizing an orientation programme prior to the commencement of the scheme.
publications.name: Orientation and its Significance on Skill Development: A Case study of AcadoPreneurship Industry Immersion Programme for Students (IIP4S)
publications.publisher: ICFNDS 2021: The 5th International Conference on Future Networks & Distributed Systems

publications.description:
Abstract 

Learning Management System (LMS) is a software platform that includes several integrated tools for delivering and managing online and virtual learning. Over time, the LMS has remained in the educational sector, providing learning opportunities to learners over dispersed locations. Hence, this paper presents a review of existing features, technologies built into LMS and its adaptation. It also highlights the effect of LMS on students' ability to learn and their performance and factors that may influence the adoption of the LMS platforms. The paper concludes with recommendations on methodology for establishing a student-centred approach, collaborative learning.

Abstrait

Le système de Gestion de l'Apprentissage (LMS) est une plate-forme logicielle qui comprend plusieurs outils intégrés pour la prestation et la gestion de l'apprentissage en ligne et virtuel. Au fil du temps, le LMS est resté dans le secteur de l'éducation, offrant des opportunités d'apprentissage aux apprenants dans des lieux dispersés. Par conséquent, cet article présente une revue des fonctionnalités existantes, des technologies intégrées au LMS et de son adaptation. Il met également en évidence l'effet du LMS sur la capacité d'apprentissage des étudiants et leurs performances, ainsi que les facteurs pouvant influencer l'adoption des plateformes LMS. Le document se termine par des recommandations sur la méthodologie pour établir une approche centrée sur l'étudiant, l'apprentissage collaboratif.
publications.name: Learning Management System – Review on the Adoption of Collaborative tools for Learning
publications.publisher: West African Journal of Open and Flexible Learning

publications.description:
Over 80 international students from 19 countries in Africa arrived at a renowned global research university in Kigali, Rwanda. They attended new student orientation and began their journey to pursue a master’s degree in engineering focused on information technology, artificial intelligence, or electrical and computer engineering.

Upon arrival, the students were excited to participate in a four-week orientation program consisting of academic lectures and group activities aimed to prepare them for the rigors of research-intensive graduate studies. During the fourth week of orientation, students were divided into diverse groups to work on a team project.
publications.name: Graduate Engineering Students Navigate Cultural Differences to Design Mobile Prenatal Care App for Rural Africa

message.text:
I’m excited to share that I contributed to the latest issue of Case Studies in International Education. It offers 11 thought-provoking case studies, including one that I wrote (Case 2). 

I'd like to express my sincere gratitude to Dr. Yvette Underdue Murph, DPA for her invaluable guidance, and to Mariam Sulleiman for her contribution and ensuring a smooth and enjoyable writing experience. I encourage everyone to consider submitting a case study for the Fall 2024 issue.


Visit CSIEpub.org for more. 

#InternationalEducation #CaseStudies #AcademicWriting #HigherEd

International Collaboration Sparks Global Impact: My Reflections from Mälardalen University's International Week

They say travel broadens horizons, but I'd argue that international collaboration takes it a step further. Last week, I had the privilege of participating in Mälardalen University's International Week, where I connected with inspiring individuals from around the world and gained fresh perspectives on pressing global issues.

Here are some key takeaways that resonated with me:
Ignite the Fire of Learning: The mind isn't just a vessel to be filled, but a flame to be nurtured.
Shape the Future: Manage the present, let go of the past, and create the future you envision.
Knowledge is Power, But Action is Key: Knowledge that doesn't lead to changed behavior quickly becomes irrelevant.
Transformational Partnerships: Move beyond traditional approaches to forge partnerships that drive real change.
One World, Shared Impact: We can't afford to work in silos anymore. Collaboration is essential to achieving the Sustainable Development Goals.
SOS - Self, Organization, Society: Consider the impact of your actions on yourself, your organization, and society as a whole.
Vasudhaiva Kutumbakam - One Earth, One Family, One Future: This ancient Indian philosophy, similar to Ubuntu in Africa, reminds us of our interconnectedness and the need to revisit traditional wisdom for modern solutions.
From Destruction to Survival: We must shift our global security strategy from "mutually assured destruction" to "mutually assured survival."
Financial Security and Prosperity for All: We can achieve this through knowledge, innovation, and trust.
Peace and Prosperity Go Hand in Hand: We cannot build a better world if people are hungry.
The Power of Humanity: Our shared humanity is a powerful force for good.
Education is Key: Investing in education, especially in Africa, is crucial for global progress.

These conversations highlighted the need to address crises more comprehensively, moving beyond selective intervention. By working together towards peace, dialogue, and shared prosperity, we can create a world where everyone thrives.

The Rwandan delegation shared powerful lessons from the 1994 Genocide against the Tutsi.  Meanwhile, expert discussions with organizations like IRCAD Africa, ABB, WeSchool ExEd, and the United Nations shed light on innovative solutions in healthcare, energy, governance, and AI.

I extend my heartfelt thanks to our host Mälardalen University, Mälardalen Student Union, Martin Hellström, Sara Arvidson, and Ebba Berg Gorgén, Lova Libert, Shervin Pirani, as well as all the speakers and participants for their valuable insights. I'm also grateful for the support of Prof. Conrad Tucker, Carnegie Mellon University Africa, and Carnegie Mellon University.

Special thanks to: Mbaranga Gasarabwe, Uday Salunkhe, #StefanLöfven, Alphonse Muleefu, Freddy Mutanguha, David Kamanda, Lukas Dust, Alice Urusaro U. Karekezi, Christer Nygren, Moris Behnam

Africa is a canvas of opportunities. To explore and fully leverage these opportunities, one key component in our day and age is building solutions to unmet needs in our communities, states, nations, and continent with sustainability and scalability in mind. I am passionate about leveraging #entrepreneurship, #tech, and #education to drive change across #Africa.

One of my current focuses is contributing to strengthening #Kigali's entrepreneurial ecosystem with The FutureList's Innovation Scout program - https://lnkd.in/dDxEEFCZ and I am excited to connect with innovators in Kigali, Africa and beyond. 

Program Benefits:
- Identifying, profiling, and supporting fast-growing startups in Kigali and Africa
- Developing compelling innovation and investor memos
- Performing trend analysis within key sectors
- Building relationships with innovators and supporters through networking and events

I'm eager to tap into the experience of The FutureList team, Chris Suzdak, Fred Swaniker, and Daniel Boateng in supporting African innovation.

Know an exciting Kigali-based founder, VC, hub manager, or a must-attend startup event? Drop a comment below 👇 or DM me.

#Africa #Innovation #Entrepreneurship #Kigali #StartupEcosystem #TechForGood #SDG #ImpactInvesting

Celebrating Innovation and Success at the CMU-Africa Rapid Prototyping Bootcamp! 🚀

This past Saturday, the Carnegie Mellon University Africa campus was buzzing with creativity and innovation as the Africa Innovators Society hosted an unforgettable Rapid Prototyping Bootcamp. We embarked on a one-day journey that transformed ideas into tangible prototypes, leveraging the powerful no-code tools of FlutterFlow.

Participants, ranging from ambitious students to seasoned entrepreneurs, gained invaluable skills and insights, propelling their entrepreneurial journeys to new heights. Our workshop was led by a constellation of leading minds in technology and innovation:

Prof. João Barros - Research Professor Carnegie Mellon University Africa & Former Founder/CEO at Veniam and Streambolico
Eilidh Southren - Senior Enterprise Solutions Architect
Jasper Jia - Founder of Nomo Codes & Snapchat Senior Designer
David Masoperh - Founder of Pebla & CMU Africa Student
Dias Zhumagaliyev - FlutterFlow Expert & Founder.

A special thank you to Muhammad Aliyu, Samuel Malum, Marie Cynthia ABIJURU KAMIKAZI, Brian Bosho, Abel Tessema, and everyone who participated and made this event not just a success, but a milestone for #entrepreneurship in #Africa.

As we reflect on a day filled with learning, creating, and networking, we're reminded of the power of community and innovation. This bootcamp wasn't just about building prototypes; it was about building the future.

Stay tuned for more events as we continue to empower and inspire the next generation of innovators. Here's to turning ideas into reality, one prototype at a time!

#RapidPrototyping #Bootcamp #CMUAfrica

"You don't appreciate what you have until it's gone."

This saying hit home for me recently. I broke my glasses 👓 last week, and after struggling with vision issues, I visited my optometrist. After an exam and a temporary eye drop, I was blurry for hours. It made me realize how much I take clear sight for granted 👀.

This experience reminded me of the verse, Fa Bi-ayyi Ala-i Rabbikuma Tukaththibani - "Which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?" (Surah Ar-Rahman). We often underestimate the everyday blessings in our lives.

May we all cultivate a deep sense of gratitude for the gifts we have 🙏.

What is one blessing you're grateful for today? Share in the comments below.

Photo credit: https://lnkd.in/dysws7xp
